children.name: Anomalies and Events
children.description: Anomalous activity is detected in a timely manner and the potential impact of events is understood.

children.name: DE.AE-1
children.description: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed

children.name: DE.AE-2
children.description: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods

children.name: DE.AE-3
children.description: Event data are aggregated and correlated from multiple sources and sensors

children.name: DE.AE-4
children.description: Impact of events is determined

children.name: DE.AE-5
children.description: Incident alert thresholds are established

children.name: Security Continuous Monitoring
children.description: The information system and assets are monitored at discrete intervals to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures.

children.name: DE.CM-1
children.description: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

children.name: DE.CM-2
children.description: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

children.name: DE.CM-3
children.description: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

children.name: DE.CM-4
children.description: Malicious code is detected

children.name: DE.CM-5
children.description: Unauthorized mobile code is detected

children.name: DE.CM-6
children.description: External service provider activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

children.name: DE.CM-7
children.description: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed

children.name: DE.CM-8
children.description: Vulnerability scans are performed

children.name: Detection Processes
children.description: Detection processes andprocedures are maintained and tested to ensure timely and adequate awareness of anomalous events.

children.name: DE.DP-1
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well defined to ensure accountability

children.name: DE.DP-2
children.description: Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements

children.name: DE.DP-3
children.description: Detection processes are tested

children.name: DE.DP-4
children.description: Event detection information is communicated to appropriate parties

children.name: DE.DP-5
children.description: Detection processes are continuously improved

children.name: Respone Planning
children.description: Response processes and procedures are executed and maintained, to ensure timely response to detected cybersecurity events.

children.name: RS.RP-1
children.description: Response plan is executed during or after an event

children.name: Communications
children.description: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders, as appropriate, to include external support from law enforcement agencies.

children.name: RS.CO-1
children.description: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed

children.name: RS.CO-2
children.description: Events are reported consistent with established criteria

children.name: RS.CO-3
children.description: Information is shared consistent with response plans

children.name: RS.CO-4
children.description: Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans

children.name: RS.CO-5
children.description: Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness

children.name: Analysis
children.description: Analysis is conducted to ensure adequate response and support recovery activities.

children.name: RS.AN-1
children.description: Notifications from detection systems are investigated

children.name: RS.AN-2
children.description: The impact of the incident is understood

children.name: RS.AN-3
children.description: Forensics are performed

children.name: RS.AN-4
children.description: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans

children.name: Mitigation
children.description: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and eradicate the incident.

children.name: RS.MI-1
children.description: Incidents are contained

children.name: RS.MI-2
children.description: Incidents are mitigated

children.name: RS.MI-3
children.description: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks

children.name: Improvements
children.description: Organizational response activities are improved by incorporating lessons learned from current and previous detection/response activities.

children.name: RS.IM-1
children.description: Response plans incorporate lessons learned

children.name: RS.IM-2
children.description: Response strategies are updated

children.name: Recovery Planning
children.description: Recovery Planning Desc

children.name: RC.RP-1
children.description: Recovery plan is executed during or after an event.

children.name: Improvements
children.description: Recovery planning and processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned into future activities.

children.name: RC.IM-1
children.description: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned.

children.name: RC.IM-2
children.description: Recovery strategies are updated.

children.name: Communications
children.description: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties, such as coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors.

children.name: RC.CO-1
children.description: Public relations are managed.

children.name: RC.CO-2
children.description: Reputation after an event is repaired.

children.name: RC.CO-3
children.description: Recovery activities are communicated to internal stakeholders and executive and management teams.
